summary: the respiratory effects of prolonged respirator use on pregnant women are unclear although there has been no definite evidence of harm from past use. pulmonary function of 20 subjects was measured whilst at rest and exercising to the predetermined workload while breathing ambient air first. there were no changes in the maternal and fetal heart rates, finger-tip capillary lactate levels and oxygen saturation. there were however no changes in the maternal and fetal heart rates, finger-tip capillary lactate levels and oxygen saturation.
